page.title: 19GROWTH OF BACKWELL
page.content: Backwell used to be four hamlets (West town,Farleigh,Church Town and Backwell itself.)These hamlets spread out and formed a larger village,Backwell.These parts remain and have the A370 running through them. The houses are fairly large, some with thatched roofs, small windows, small doors and chimneys. Most of them have large gardens. Some of the old buildings have been converted into houses,e.g. the old bakery and the old school house. The younger houses are built of limestone with slate roofs and the modern houses are built of brick. Backwell used to be a farming area and the labourers used to live in Backwell village. Now most of the people go to work in Bristol and nearby towns. Backwell has at least doubled in the last twenty years.
